title: bottega veneta logo
content:
can anyone help identify the font used in the bottega veneta logo?

thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bottega-veneta-logo_3736.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bottega-veneta-logo2-465x220_4199.jpg)
author: gncalix

comments.content:
There are 2 different logos here and bottom one is very [Times New Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/times) (or [Times Ten](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/times+ten)).  
Current logo (and official I guess) is first sample. For this one, I don't have a match and I doubt there's one as almost all woodmarks from the fashion industry are custom lettering. I can only suggest 2 very (very...) loosely similar, [Kumlien](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/kumlien-pro) and [Berling](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/berling) and upload a better sample.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bv_5252.jpeg)

kind of hard to find a higher res image but here are a few

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/imagesCA9ZGC2H_4072.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bottega_01_6468.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223155809im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BottegaVeneta_main112211_3956.jpg)

it seems like it varies slighty...maybe its just my eyes or the image quality.

their website is a bit more clear.
I thought they started with Palatino and made it thinner manually.
